com.xing.api.resources

Class MessagesResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xing.api.Resource
      • com.xing.api.resources.MessagesResource

  • public class MessagesResource
extends Resource
    Represent the 'Messages' resource.

    Provides methods which allow access to user's conversations.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getConversationsByUserId

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<Conversation>,HttpError> getConversationsByUserId(java.lang.String userId)
        Gets a list of user's conversations. The data returned by this call will be checked and filtered on the basis of the privacy settings of each requested user.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. Must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. Must be a positive number. Default: 0
        strip_html Specifies whether the message content should be stripped of HTML (true) or not (false). The default value is false.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        with_latest_messages Number of latest messages to include. Must be non-negative. Default: 0, Maximum: 100
        Parameters:
        userId - Id of the user to request its conversations.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'List user conversations' resource page

      • createConversation

        public CallSpec<Conversation,HttpError> createConversation(java.lang.String userId,
                                                           java.lang.String subject,
                                                           java.lang.String content,
                                                           java.lang.String... recipientIds)
        Starts a conversation by sending the passed message to the recipients. The subject of a conversation cannot be changed afterwards. Basic members are not allowed to send messages to non-contacts. Premium members are limited to 20 messages to non-contacts per month.
        Parameters:
        content - Message text with max size of 16384 UTF-8 characters
        recipientIds - Comma-separated list of recipients. There must be between one and 10 recipients. Sender cannot be included.
        subject - Subject for conversation. Max. size is 255 UTF-8 characters
        userId - Id of the user starting the conversation
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Create a conversation' resource page

      • validateRecipient

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> validateRecipient(java.lang.String userId)
        Check if it's possible to send a message to the selected recipient. The call will return a 404 if the recipient is not valid.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user that should be validated
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Validate recipient

      • getSingleConversation

        public CallSpec<Conversation,HttpError> getSingleConversation(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                              java.lang.String userId)
        Show a Conversation Returns a single conversation. This call returns the same conversations format as the getConversationsByUserId(String) call.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        strip_html Specifies whether the message content should be stripped of HTML (true) or not (false). The default value is false.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        with_latest_messages Number of latest messages to include. Must be non-negative. Default: 0, Maximum: 100
        Parameters:
        conversationId - Conversation that you want to retrieve
        userId - ID of the user owwning the conversation
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Show a conversation

      • getAttachmentsOfConversation

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<MessageAttachment>,HttpError> getAttachmentsOfConversation(java.lang.String conversationId)
        Get all attachments of a conversation. Aggregate the attachments of all messages in a conversations.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. This must be a positive number. Default: 10
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        offset Offset. This must be a positive number. Default: 0
        Parameters:
        conversationId - Id of the conversation that you want to get the attachments from.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Get all attachments of a conversation

      • getAttachmentDownloadLink

        public CallSpec<java.lang.String,HttpError> getAttachmentDownloadLink(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                                      java.lang.String attachmentId)
        Create Download link for attachment. The URL will be returned via response body and is valid for 300 seconds.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - Id of the conversation that the attachment belongs to
        attachmentId - id of the (@link MessageAttachment that you want to receive the download link for
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Create a temporary URL to download an attachment.

      • markConversationAsRead

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> markConversationAsRead(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                                 java.lang.String userId)
        Mark a conversation as read. Marks all messages in the conversation as read.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - Conversation Id that should be marked as read
        userId - ID of the user owwning the message
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:

      • getConversationMessages

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<ConversationMessage>,HttpError> getConversationMessages(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                                                       java.lang.String userId)
        Show conversation messages. Return the messages for a conversation.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. Must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. Must be a positive number. Default: 0
        strip_html Specifies whether the message content should be stripped of HTML (true) or not (false). The default value is false.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - Id of conversation that you want to retrieve the messages from.
        userId - ID of the user owning the message
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Show conversation messages

      • getSingleConversationMessage

        public CallSpec<ConversationMessage,HttpError> getSingleConversationMessage(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                                            java.lang.String messageId,
                                                                            java.lang.String userId)
        Show a message. Returns a single message.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        strip_html Specifies whether the message content should be stripped of HTML (true) or not (false). The default value is false.
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - The conversation ID from which you want to retrieve the message
        messageId - The Id of the message you want to retrieve
        userId - Id of the user that wants to retrieve the message
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Show a message.

      • markMessageAsRead

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> markMessageAsRead(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                                            java.lang.String messageId,
                                                            java.lang.String userId)
        Mark message as read. Marks a message in a conversation as read.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user marks the message as read
        conversationId - Id of the conversation that holds the message to be marked as read
        messageId - Id of the message that should be marked as read.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        Mark message as unread

        Parameters:
